intro: Verbesina fuscasiccans, commonly known as the brownseed beggar-tick, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and rough, hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by dry, capsule-like fruits. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, stiff hairs, which contribute to its rough texture. Verbesina fuscasiccans is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showcasing its adaptability to various environments.
